title: Edu-GArD3n Welcomes Five Leading European Universities
author: Project Coordination Team
summary: The consortium expands with five prestigious European institutions joining forces to advance green additive manufacturing education.
content_markdown:
## A New Era of Collaboration

We are thrilled to announce the official formation of the **Edu-GArD3n consortium**, bringing together five leading European universities committed to revolutionizing green additive manufacturing education.

## Consortium Partners

### Czech Technical University in Prague (Coordinator)
Bringing decades of expertise in mechanical engineering and additive manufacturing research.

### University of Padova, Italy
Renowned for sustainability research and materials science innovation.

### Technical University of Munich, Germany
Leaders in industrial engineering and green technology development.

### Delft University of Technology, Netherlands
Pioneers in design engineering and circular economy principles.

### Aalto University, Finland
Experts in sustainable design and digital fabrication.

## Our Mission

Together, we aim to:
- Develop comprehensive curricula for green AM education
- Create open-access learning resources
- Foster international student and faculty exchange
- Bridge the gap between academia and industry
- Promote sustainable manufacturing practices across Europe

## Looking Ahead

This partnership represents a significant step toward establishing Europe as a global leader in sustainable manufacturing education. Over the next three years, we will collaborate to create innovative learning materials, organize workshops and summer schools, and engage with industry partners.

*The project is co-funded by the European Union under the Erasmus+ Programme.*
